definitions.text: informal terms for a difficult situation
examples: he got into a terrible fix
he made a muddle of his marriage

definitions.text: something craved, especially an intravenous injection of a narcotic drug
examples: she needed a fix of chocolate

definitions.text: the act of putting something in working order again
an exemption granted after influence (e.g., money) is brought to bear
examples: collusion resulted in tax fixes for gamblers

definitions.text: a determination of the place where something is
examples: he got a good fix on the target

definitions.text: restore by replacing a part or putting together what is torn or broken
examples: She repaired her TV set
Repair my shoes please
fasten the lock onto the door
she fixed her gaze on the man
fix the variables
specify the parameters

definitions.text: prepare for eating by applying heat
examples: Cook me dinner, please
can you make me an omelette?
fix breakfast for the guests, please

definitions.text: take vengeance on or get even
examples: We'll get them!
That'll fix him good!
This time I got him
Let's fix the date for the party!

definitions.text: kill, preserve, and harden (tissue) in order to prepare for microscopic study

examples: let's fix the picture to the frame
in some countries, people with genetically transmissible disabilites are sterilized

definitions.text: influence an event or its outcome by illegal means
examples: fix a race
She posited her hand on his shoulder
deposit the suitcase on the bench
fix your eyes on this spot

definitions.text: make ready or suitable or equip in advance for a particular purpose or for some use, event, etc
examples: Get the children ready for school!
prepare for war
I was fixing to leave town after I paid the hotel bill
